availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Monticello, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Emerine Ingram Buster in Wayne County, Kentucky, on November 8, 1841. Father of Nimrod Ingram Buster. Farmer in Wayne County in 1850. Farmer in Monticello in 1860. Owned nine enslaved people in Wayne County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, Division 1, p. 284A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, p. 236.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, p. 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Wayne County Marriages, Film #000591550.
Find A Grave, "Charles Hayden Buster (1822-1869)," Memorial #58236832, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58236832 (accessed January 6, 2020).
